data.title: Downtown
data.text: This particular Subway is in a really good location. You have the court buildings, public transportation, and other local businesses that need somewhere quick to go for lunch.

data.title: Needs Cleaned
data.text: I don't understand why almost every Subway restaurant has filthy dirty floors, food on the tables, and greasy marks on everything.  This one is good enough for take out only.

data.title: was quick to get a bite
data.text: not normally like to go downtown but wanted a quick bite and subway has a coupon so I used it before a meeting.

data.title: All ther Subway menu is there and served promtly
data.text:
The full menu at regionally going prices is there. After going there 2 years+ I can't recall them ever being out of any sub ingredient except tomatoes one time, but occasionally one of the bread choices isn't "in stock." Their sandwich artists seem to be well-trained and are product knowledgeable and fast. They are friendly and seem to enjoy their work.
Restaurant is large for a Subway, with several tables for an eat-in lunch, but in an older building with a bit tired 1900's decor. Possibly because of that, the first impression is that the place is not as clean as some of the newer buildouts, but actually it appears to me to be comfortably clean. Entering patrons must walk by the tables to get to the counter, so the atmosphere is "commuter station busy" at lunch hour.

data.title: Love their subs but....
data.text: I do love their subs.  Only problem I have is the smell.  I have heard that the smell is from the bread but I hate going into the restaurant.  I prefer to go through the carryout but when I do that they almost always make a mistake with my order.  But, I DO LOVE THEIR SANDWICHES.

data.title: Sandubas
data.text: Tradicional e renomada lanchonete de rede mundialmente conhecida especializada em montar sanduyiches de acordo com o gosto do cliente

user_location.name: Rio de Janeiro, Rio de Janeiro, Brazil
